data.text:
Lawrence C. “Larry” Miller, 93, of Bethlehem Township died Thursday, June 27, 2024 in the Inpatient Hospice Unit at Lehigh Valley Hospital, Allentown. He was the beloved husband of Carolyn D. (Homan) Miller. They celebrated their 64th wedding anniversary on April 1, 2024. Born in Bethlehem, he was the son of the late Charles and Hattie (Moser) Miller. Larry was a truck driver and all around handyman for the former Bob Young Trucking, Bethlehem for 35 years until retiring in 2007. He was a talented woodworker whose artwork could be found throughout the family home. A gifted chef and baker, Larry’s clambakes and family gatherings were something everyone looked forward to. His strawberry pie was a favorite. He had made one the week before he died. He was a member of Wesley United Methodist Church, Bethlehem.

Survivors: Wife; sons, Lawrence C. Miller, Jr. and his wife Teteka of OH, Wayne H. Miller of Bethlehem; grandson, Bradley Miller and his wife Lauren of NC. He was predeceased by siblings, Marvin Miller, Eleanor Stahr, Thelma Hoffman and Ruth Resh.

Service: Graveside Service 11:30AM Friday, July 5, 2024 at Bethlehem Memorial Park, 1851 Linden St., Bethlehem. Viewing 10 to 11:00AM Friday, July 5, 2024 at Cantelmi Long Funeral Home, 500 Linden St., Bethlehem.

Contributions: Memorials in Larry’s memory may be made to Wesley United Methodist Church, 2540 Center St., Bethlehem, PA 18017.
